intro: Pleomele perrottetii, commonly known as the red-veined druid's shield, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its striking, shield-shaped leaves with deep red veins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in spring. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
